page.title: 05MORE NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: SHAFTS HAVE BECOME TIPS & THERE THE BARN OWL HUNTS FOR RATS.THE LITTLE OWL OCCURS BUT WE ARE NOT CERTAIN WHETHER THEY NEST. IN GARDENS AND HEDGEROWS WE SEE CHAFFINCHES,SONG THRUSH,WREN,DUNNOCK, BLACKBIRD,MAGPIES,GREENFINCH,BLUE TIT, GREAT TIT,HOUSE SPARROW & ALL THE COMMON HEDGEROW BIRDS OF THE NORTH OF ENGLAND. A FREQUENT VISITOR TO THE PONDS IS THE HERON.ANOTHER WATERSIDE CREATURE IS THE COMMON TOAD,IT REALLY IS COMMON IN THIS AREA,OFTEN BEING FOUND IN THE SCHOOL GARDEN. OTHER REPTILES OF THE DISTRICT ARE ADDER,GRASS SNAKE,COMMON NEWT & COMMON FROG. THERE ARE BATS,AND A FEW YEARS AGO A DEAD LONG-EARED BAT WAS BROUGHT TO SCHOOL BY ONE OF THE CHILDREN.
